summary: The national flag of Germany is a horizontal tricolour of black, red, and gold. It was first used in 1848 and officially adopted in 1919. The colors represent Germany's history and were used during the Weimar Republic and the Federal Republic (since 1949). There's also a rival set of colors, black-white-red, associated with the German Empire and later the Nazis. Using the wrong flag can be against the law in Germany.
title: Flag of Germany
